ancestryfeature1: Purposeful Design: Decide who made you and for what purpose. At character creation, choose one of your Experiences that best aligns with this purpose and gain a permanent +1 bonus to it. (Clank)
Scales: Your scales act as natural protection. When you would take Severe damage, you can mark a Stress to mark 1 fewer Hit Points. (Drakona)
Thick Skin: When you take Minor damage, you can mark 2 Stress instead of marking a Hit Point. (Dwarf)
Quick Reactions: Mark a Stress to gain advantage on a reaction roll. (Elf)
Luckbender: Once per session, after you or a willing ally within Close range makes an action roll, you can spend 3 Hope to reroll the Duality Dice. (Faerie)
Caprine Leap: You can leap anywhere within Close range as though you were using normal movement, allowing you to vault obstacles, jump across gaps, or scale barriers with ease. (Faun)

Charge: When you succeed on an Agility Roll to move from Far or Very Far range into Melee range with one or more targets, you can mark a Stress to deal 1d12 physical damage to all targets within Melee range. (Firbolg)
Fungril Network: Make an Instinct Roll (12) to use your mycelial array to speak with others of your ancestry. On a success, you can communicate across any distance. (Fungril)
Shell: Gain a bonus to your damage thresholds equal to your Proficiency. (Galapa)
Endurance: Gain an additional Hit Point slot at character creation. (Giant)
Surefooted: You ignore disadvantage on Agility Rolls. (Goblin)
Luckbringer: At the start of each session, everyone in your party gains a Hope. (Halfling)
High Stamina: Gain an additional Stress slot at character creation. (Human)
Fearless: When you roll with Fear, you can mark 2 Stress to change it into a roll with Hope instead. (Infernis)
Feline Instincts: When you make an Agility Roll, you can spend 2 Hope to reroll your Hope Die. (Katari)
Sturdy: When you have 1 Hit Point remaining, attacks against you have disadvantage. (Orc)
Amphibious: You can breathe and move naturally underwater. (Ribbet)
Natural Climber: You have advantage on Agility Rolls that involve balancing and climbing. (Simiah)
ancestryfeature2: Efficient: When you take a short rest, you can choose a long rest move instead of a short rest move. (Clank)

Elemental Breath: Choose an element for your breath (such as electricity, fire, or ice). You can use this breath against a target or group of targets within Very Close range, treating it as an Instinct weapon that deals d8 magic damage using your Proficiency. (Drakona)
Increased Fortitude: Spend 3 Hope to halve incoming physical damage. (Dwarf)
Celestial Trance: During a rest, you can drop into a trance to choose an additional downtime move . (Elf)
Wings: You can fly. While flying, you can mark a Stress after an adversary makes an attack against you to gain a +2 bonus to your Evasion against that attack. (Faerie)

Kick: When you succeed on an attack against a target within Melee range, you can mark a Stress to kick yourself off them, dealing an extra 2d6 damage and knocking back either yourself or the target to Very Close range. (Faun)
Unshakable: When you would mark a Stress, roll a d6. On a result of 6, don't mark it. (Firbolg)
Death Connection: While touching a corpse that died recently, you can mark a Stress to extract one memory from the corpse related to a specific emotion or sensation of your choice. (Fungril)
Retract: Mark a Stress to retract into your shell. While in your shell, you have resistance to physical damage, you have disadvantage on action rolls, and you can't move. (Galapa)
Reach: Treat any weapon, ability, spell, or other feature that has a Melee range as though it has a Very Close range instead. (Giant)
Danger Sense: Once per rest, mark a Stress to force an adversary to reroll an attack against you or an ally within Very Close range. (Goblin)
Internal Compass: When you roll a 1 on your Hope Die, you can reroll it. (Halfling)
Adaptability: When you fail a roll that utilized one of your Experiences, you can mark a Stress to reroll. (Human)
Dread Visage: You have advantage on rolls to intimidate hostile creatures. (Infernis)
Retracting Claws: Make an Agility Roll to scratch a target within Melee range. On a success, they become temporarily Vulnerable. (Katari)
Tusks: When you succeed on an attack against a target within Melee range, you can spend a Hope to gore the target with your tusks, dealing an extra 1d6 damage. (Orc)

Long Tongue: You can use your long tongue to grab onto things within Close range. Mark a Stress to use your tongue as a Finesse Close weapon that deals d12 physical damage using your Proficiency. (Ribbet)
Nimble: Gain a permanent +1 bonus to your Evasion at character creation. (Simiah)
